title: Why won't the AP Assassins be getting new itemization?
body: It seems as though the new lethality system is only going to apply to the AD assassins. So far the only assassin items getting changed are AD. Why won't the AP assassins be getting any new toys? Lich Bane could stand some changes as well as ludens. Just wondering is all.

replies.body: Yeah... All the new assassin items have unique passives and actives and encourage assassin play styles, meanwhile ap assassins have... Ludens...

The issue with the changing the way armor penetration works isn't to suit the assassins but rather to make sure ADCs don't abuse assassin items like they have been. That's not an issue with AP items which is why it's not getting changed at this point.
They already got decent itemization tbh

I'd like more things that are set apart from the standard Mage itemization. And you could just as easily say that AD assassins had decent itemization before this update as well. It's a class update for crying out loud, and half the class is just gonna be ignored? There's going to be a whole new mechanic just for assassins "lethality" that the AP variants won't even get to partake in.

So how would they make an AP item that is favored by AP assassins & won't be abused by every other AP champ in the game?
The only way I can think of is having Riot create some unique stat only AP assassins have & create/ rework items with that stat in mind. That's the only way I can think of to stop champs like Annie, Syndra, Veigar, AP Sona, etc from abusing any possible AP assassin item.

Buddy, AP assassins works just fine with the AP items available.
Well they are creating a unique stat only AD assassins have and are doing exactly what you describe with them.
Um no, they're not creating an unique stat, they're just reworking how flat armor pen works & giving it a new name.

Then why not rework how flat magic pen works as well? They could make it so that percent pen is a stat for mages making them good team fighters and tank busters while the ap assassins build the items that have the new flat pen stat. This would focus the assassins attention on squishy targets like they thematically should be doing and make them more inherently weak to tankier targets.
